reviews.review_msg: clearly has white guilt and everything has to do with aboriginal culture. Please don't take her class. Professors should not include their political and personal beliefs into their teachings as I have learned nothing in this class.

Brenda is nice but this course literally is not what the Course description says. no need to attend lecture as you aren't tested on anything. paper had unclear expectations and she was unable to provide concrete feedback. save yourself and just take this class with another prof

so disappointed as I was excited to learn the topics that shouldve been covered in class. What a waste of money and time. Slides filled with quotes- and worksheets were due every week (you can submit them late though in exchange for marks off). She obviously has white guilt which probably causes her to focus on irrelevant indigenous topics.

Disorganized teaching style.Course was fully focused on indigenous concepts and teachings rather than psychological explanations.Tons of random readings & long podcasts.Expectations for the final 12pg essay were unclear until last min and my wonderful TA mentioned asking her many times for clarification but could not get any. Don't take her class.
if you think ur gonna come to class, don't. literally nothing mentioned is relevant
not it, boss

If you can take this course with a different prof DO IT. Brenda is horribly disorganized and taught no core concepts. We got random emails for podcasts to listen to for Monday lecture ON A SUNDAY NIGHT. No real grading criteria, it was posted on lecture slides and wasn't even written by her. This should be an easy class but she makes it awful.

I tried to switch classes but failed. This course is NOT psychological and is all Indigenous based- which is important but not what is described when enrolling. The slides are all quotes. There are 'worksheets' every week as well and the final is 12 pages which has has the criteria changed multiple times and locked until asked not to be. Don't take

Do not make my mistake and listen to the prof ratings. Most of the course was her talking about anything else other than the course content. Instructions were unclear, most tutorials students would hound the TA for instructions. Everyone was confused on the course. This classes content isn't difficult, only difficult because the prof.
BRING FENT!
Learned more about the psychology of deviance and crime from saul Goodman

Brenda, while passionate about what she is talking about, made this course not at all what it is supposed to be. every topic we covered pretty much had nothing to do with psychological explanations of crime. no point in going to any of the lectures as none of the information in them is useful
Overall Brenda is a good prof but her lecture can get a bit boring. Also she talks more about other  subjects rather than what the course is suppose to be about.
Brenda is passionate about what she teaches. They are approachable, always willing to help, and provide clear explanations. The course was engaging, and I felt well-supported throughout.

My friend took crim 103 with J. Wong, learned about psychopaths, drugs, m*rderers, and interesting theories of crime.

In this class with Morrison though, you'll learn none of this, or she will touch on a topic lightly and that's it.

The class is easy, no exams, but if you want to learn about interesting topics don't take it with her.

Horrible, most of the things she rambles on about in lecture has nothing to do with course material. I understand that cultural appreciation is important, but I'm here to learn about criminology, not indigenous studies.

unorganized does not begin to describe her, does not post/open materials on time, provides criteria for papers then reveals weeks after the due date that it was graded on criteria never told to students to make it more difficult to get an A, the semester is almost done and we have not received a single grade back for the entire course

Brenda's lectures are pretty much pointless. Assignment guidelines/rubric are nonexistent. She is also extremely disorganized. The tutorials are just games and ice breaker activities. The TAs are nice but Brenda does not seem to put any effort into this class. We had a critical essay assignment due during reading week so that was quite annoying.

Brenda's teaching methods are completely USELESS for the average person. Her lecture slides are mainly confusing quotes and she ramles about everything and anything that could not be any less related to the course. I have attended every lecture and tutorial and have not learned a single thing about psychology or criminology. DO NOT TAKE
I cannot urge you enough donot take this course. The assignment guidelines and vague, Tutorials are a waste of time and the work load is huge and sporadic simply because this prof is unorganized.

Brenda is genuinely one of the worst profs I have had as a 4th year. She is so messy, we are a month into the course and she has been so unprepared. She doesn't reply to e-mails AT ALL, her lectures are so jumbled that I don't even watch them anymore because they teach nothing. Only plus is the TA so far is absolutely lovely
Brenda is very messy and goes on rambles during lectures without making a point. She quotes more people in her lecture slides than actually giving us information and definitions. DO NOT TAKE!!

I waited 3 years to get into this class because the enrolment system sucks. Brenda does not cover ANYTHING about psychology and barely touches on her own lecture slides. No point in going to lecture, honestly don't waste your money if she is the prof. You won't learn anything or benefit from this. Extremely disappointed and SFU needs to fix this.

I am a third year student and I can confidently say this is the worst professor I have had at this school so far. Her lectures didn't teach us anything, I wouldn't recommend going. She assigns heavy reading and video material, like being assigned 2 hours of video to watch and a bunch of readings. If you are enrolled, find a different class or prof.

Dr. Morrison's teachings are irrelevant to what is listed in the description of this course as there is nothing about biogenetic, psychiatric, and psychological explanations of crime and deviance. She instead focuses on Indigenous and social explanations, which although are important, are not what we PAID to learn. Nothing about psychology. AVOID!!

this class is so interesting so its extremely disappointing that for an online class students have to beg the professor to post the weekly materials and she neglects to open assignments til right before the deadline but does not provide extensions. She seems nice but sfu should have someone else who can actually support the students run the course
she just compared a domestic terrorist with someone who chopped down a tree...
Terrible course she didn't show up and the essay was worth 45% of the grade that had nothing to do with "psychological explanations".

Do not take this class with this teacher. She teaches nothing that has to do with psychological explanations and all to do with indigenous explanations. It seems she neglected this course to be more present for her other courses.

Brenda needs to be studied. She taught us NOTHING about the psychology of crime and deviance, setting us up to struggle in our next courses. Class was always cancelled, or didn't bother giving a notice. We paid for an in-person class but were given an online class. She rambles about Indigenous people for the entirety of every Zoom lecture. dont.

Brenda canceled all but two classes to attend to her personal projects and left us to deal with her annoying laptop in zoom classes. We had no solid outline for our term project, you had to dig for information from recorded lectures. The TA was nice but we wouldn't get our grades or feedback in time to add changes to our next work. Don't take it!!!

CRIM 315 as a 4-credit course was awesome. It was weekly worksheets, discussions, and tutorials. The tutorials were the only ones I liked my whole academic career! For anyone who didn't enjoy it, simply were too lazy to do the super easy weekly things. The papers were long which is the downside. She records her lectures, no attendance is needed.

Brenda cancelled 8/10 of her lectures and seemed to want to pursue her own little passion projects rather than teach us about Crime and Deviance. She didn't talk about crime and deviance at all and it was Indigenous based, not criminology based. Her own TA referred us to a youtube playlist because Brenda didnt teach us anything. 0/10 dont take this

Great and engaging tutorials. We would literally play games for about an hour. 2 papers, first one is 12-14 pages and the second one is 16-18 pages. I have no problem with Brenda because her lectures were online, to which I never attended. However, all you need to do is show up to fun tutorials and write papers.

unbelievable course that has nothing to do with the name: psychological explanations. all we talked about was indigenous stuff I didn't pay my money to learn. She was crying in the online (supposed to be in person) lectures, super unprofessional. make sure when taking Crim 103 that it isn't with brenda Morrison. sad class. waste of money.

There actually needs to be something done about this professor. How can she get away by teaching us a course like this??? Why is she even teaching if she cannot actually hold an in person class because her life is apparently so complicated. Someone needs to email the dean about this or something. This class will waste peoples money and is not okay!

(part 3) I feel bad for everyone taking this course like I am! By the way she was also crying in a few of the zoom lectures which I thought was odd because there was no professionalism whatsoever. Attendance was semi-mandatory (mainly for tutorial).

(part 2) My mark for the paper outline and annotated bibliography were decent but still!! What is this?! The TA was Chelsey Lee and she also taught this course to which she told us to refer to Evan McCuish another CRIM prof here at SFU. THATS CRAZY

(part 1) I do not recommend taking ANY courses with this professor, she actually made criminology uninteresting with her constant rants of god knows what!! The TA was rarely helpful and when it came to asking questions about the paper the TA nor the PROF would be able to give a clear answer up until the FINAL WEEK!!!

I don't feel like i learned anything new from this class in terms of criminological theory. Brenda's speciality is restorative
justice, and when she did lecture, it was pretty interesting, but it was not what I paid to learn. I paid for an in-person class and got an online class that was loosely based on course material.

Worst professor in sfu, cancels lectures and uses the most dishonest excuses. Completely disregards the fact that students taking criminology need to learn certain topics to help with understanding upper level courses by completely changing Crim 103 to her class. Needs fired ASAP!!!!!!!!!!!

Worst Crim class ive taken so far. This isn't even psychological explanations, rather indigenous perspectives. She made so many excuses for not showing up to class like ive never seen anything like this before.
cancels classes at the last minute, rarely shows up, doesn't actually teach anything, talks a lot without saying anything
DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!! Take a different teacher please!!!!!!!!!!! The recent ratings on this prof aren't for nothing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Take another course or save your hard earned dollars!!!!

what an absolute joke of a course. I can't believe that this person has a job that pays decently well like a university prof. She is cheating her way through life with this joke that we call crim103. Something has to be done about this. We should be refunded for what is this atrocity of a university course.

PLEASEEE DO NOT TAKE CRIM 103 WITH HER IF YOU ACTUALLY WANTED TO LEARN ABOUT PHYSIOLOGICAL EXPLANATIONS OF CRIMINAL AND DEVIANT BEHAVIOR. She first of all made this an online class with cancelling all of her in person classes except for 2! The amount of excuses she had to come up with were hilarious because why am I paying for an in person class.

Brenda was consistently having "wifi problems" which led to her posting lectures weeks late, or not at all.  She has high expectations for students engagement, but engaged very little herself.  Never answered any emails.  Appeared to be prioritizing other projects and pursuits over her students and the course.  Course papers were especially long.

PART 3: Her focus on this course does not revolve around psychology at all, rather Indigenous studies, which is her field of work. If you want to take this course, take it with Evan McCuish. His course is specific to psychological deviances and crimes. I fell to my knees cause I can't take this class anymore and wasted 600 bucks. Trash ahh class.

PART 2: She puts in minimal work but expects us to be detailed and meet every single one of her expectations as well. Her assignment instructions are super vague and will only give out the informative and detailed outline of the assignments if students bombard her email with questions about it.

PART 1: Terrible x10^10. She somehow made this in person class an online one and proceeded to cancel majority of the classes during this semester. The fact that she could find so many excuses to cancel them amazes me. It ranged from being sick 2 weeks in a row to being emotionally burdened by an insignificant event, to being busy on her work.

oh my goodness. i can't even describe her inadequacy. although it was an in person class, brenda canceled more than half of the lectures with a range of excuses. one day she was stuck in a different city, the next day a tree fell in front of her house, then she simply canceled without reason. she gave us nothing and expects so much

(it was Crim 103)super sad excuse for a criminology class, worst class ive taken in my young academic career, she has so many different excuses to not show up for online lecture, the worksheets seemed to barely relate to course content. Dropped stats 203 to take this course, shouldve just stayed in there.

Best class of my undergrad. people who didn't do well did not work hard, because the TA and prof both had very clear instructions had 4th year students taken the initiative and simply asked. Brenda was so accommodating of my personal issues. Dana, Best TA ever. Don't hesitate to take this class, and put in the work to get the grade I got.

Brenda is a really nice lady, but she assigned so much homework and her papers are unnecessarily long. 
Would not take another class with her

While Brenda's teaching methods are not what we are used to as upper-division students, she is such an amazing and caring woman who really wants you to succeed. Step outside of your boxes in this class because what she does is not traditional, but that is not a bad thing at all. If you're flexible and willing to do the actual work, you'll do great

The TAs will mark your papers so hard. This class is NOT a gpa booster. Final paper was 16-18 pages what can you even talk about past the 10th page?? Literally repeated myself through the entire essay.

She was pretty absent for the majority of the semester, as a person she is caring towards the students, however with her lack of presence due to attending conferences it was hard to evaluate her teaching style.

Great Prof, i wish more teachers would embrace a more hands on teaching style like this; with talking circles, guest speakers, open-topic papers, negotiable terms and field trips!! definitely recommend 315, 442 or any special topics courses with her for sure!

She is not your average professor! she talks to students like equals and embraces real life learning techniques instead of tradition readings exams and lectures. I love her, and have taken plenty of classes with her. if you are interested in what shes teaching, you will learn! and if youre like me, you will be inspired !!

Brenda is a very kind and knowledgeable Professor, but she is quite disorganized in class and hard to listen to at times. That being said, attending lecture is not at all necessary in 315 because there are no exams and the papers are based on readings and lecture notes posted online. Simply attend tutorials and you are ok-TA KRYSTAL IS AWESOME!

Brenda doesn't teach and only gives you information in support of her ideas. It's not worth your time to attend class. Tutorial is 2 hours of ice breaking games each week and not much else. Paper dates changed without warning. The only positive is that the grading is reasonable and if you put in some effort you can pull off a good grade.

Her lectures are quite unique. She will often show short videos and bring in guest speakers. 30% of your grade comes from easy tasks such as worksheet, reflections, and tutorial participation. I would suggest that 315 with Brenda Morrison is one of the funnest classes you will take. Tutorials are not like typical crim tutorials at all. They are fun

Brenda is an awesome teacher! She takes a different approach, it's refreshing. She knows what she's talking about and he classes are very interesting. However, she is very unorganized and does not respond to emails. Sometimes expectations for assignments are unclear and there was not much structure to her class. Don't let that discourage you tho!

Brenda is clearly very passionate about what she teaches. This class was RJ in schools. Classes are interesting, however Brenda is very disorganized and often does not post assignment instructions until a few days before they are due. There is a lot of group work in this class, which is mostly a good thing. Brenda is a good prof, but disorganized
Brenda cares about her students and is passionate about what she teaches. I would recommend.

Brenda is an amazing teacher! But, she was unclear about what she expected for the essays ( first one was 10-12 pages, and the second one was 20 pages). Neither her nor the TA's helped towards the essay. Your basically on your own, and if they like what you wrote, you'll receive a fair grade. Aside from that great class, but boring lectures!!!

Took it online. Weekly Canvas discussions (25%), eight 700 word journals (50%), and one 8 - 10 page paper (25%). Not very much work for a 4-credit course. Extremely easy to do well. Very inspirational material. However, grading criteria is very vague. Gives little direction for assignments and discussions. Otherwise would highly recommend.

Neither Brenda or her TA's respond to e-mails. Unclear expectations on papers. Sends out a million e-mails that have nothing to do with the course. Didn't learn anything really and I was very interested in RJ. Tutorials are a waste of time where you do exercises talking about your feelings. I think RJ at SFU needs to be overhauled
Very disorganized and unclear of expectations on papers.

I liked the course. If students read the book, incorporated the Restorative Justice (RJ) events that were going on around town, went to your tutorials and spoke up and gave an informed opinion about RJ, you would have done well. Brenda's a fair marker. She gave examples of what a critical analysis encompases. Get someone to read your papers.

I tried extremely hard to get A in Brenda's class, but received a B mark.  Brenda is a hard marker, but a very poor instructor.  The class is filled with cheap sentimentalism that Brenda thoroughly encouraged.  Brenda gave vague verbal instructions for the essays that are worth 35% each. Brenda, please give written and detailed instructions.
Horrible should not be teaching I'm not sure how she can teach
Her lecture was boring and useless. Only thing interesting was the guest lectures. So basically she taught us nothing.

Did not like this class. She constantly sends emails about events and passed on emails from other people but does not reply to students. Unclear and disorganized. A lot of work but it took about 4 or 5 weeks to return our first 12pg paper out of 3. This class had to final exam, it was my first class finished and is the last class to send in marks.
I would not recommend her for Crim 315. She does not reply to students email and all you see if her emailing about her events. She looks down on students.

Very disorganized class and her expectations of assignments are not very clear. Criteria tend to be given within a short notice, which puts everyone unsettled. Even the way of handing in the assignments too.

The class is great, but the prof's inability to be organized ruins the exp. She has unrealistic  expectations and a hefty workload even when she knows she cant mark them in time. You get details of your assignments one week before it's due. 3 papers; each is 12 pgs long. She won't reply to emails and leaves students concerned w/o addressing them.

Must take class! Great experience. Brenda Morrison is a great lecturer, and very knowledgeable of restorative justice. Class material is very interesting, and not difficult. Put in some effort and you will receive a good grade.

I've had Brenda for Crim 315 and 417. I would highly recommend taking any course that you can with her. She is highly respected in the restorative justice community and is very passionate about her work. Her marking is not easy, but if you become passionate about what you learn, which you probably will, you will find her grading to be very fair.

My only complaints: not enough instructions on what they were looking for in the journals (besides vague references to class, articles, and book) and they were marked HARD by the TAs. In some weeks, the DVD was like 3 hrs long. You gotta add in the fact that you need to rewind the DVD sometimes so the time you spend is much longer than that.

there are 4 journals and you have to use class material, tutorial material, the BORING dvds (which are very expensive), and the readings for each week. the ta's are really picky about using everything in your journals. guest speakers were cool, the tutorial activities were fun, and overall, the class was okay.

Course is reading and writing intensive. Journals are marked pretty hard by the TAs. Prof and TAs shove RJ down your throat, any dissenting opinion will earn you a poor mark. Course is basically one long informercial on how awesome RJ is. Materials are mandatory & expensive. Only redeeming aspect of the course is the fun tutorials.

If you heard this class was easy, think again. Journals are now done differently than what you may have heard from others who took this class and the TAs actually mark quite hard. Tutorials are fun, but lectures seem disconnected. Many of the comments on this site are pretty accurate. Take this class at your own risk. Lots of work and GPA dropper.

Took Restorative Justice Crim315 with her. Her lectures are quite random leaving you clueless on what you learned at the end of the lectures. Videos required are long and boring. This course is implicit rather than explicit learning.

Not structured at all!!! Powerpoint slides are all over the place, i dont even think I learned anything which is a shame because I was really looking forward to this class. Sounds more interesting than it is. Tutorial were great! Very easy marks, all we did was play games but the journals were ALOT of work! TA's make the class good.

This was one of the best classes I've ever had at SFU. I was admittedly very skeptical of the whole RJ thing but the course really opened my eyes. Brenda was also our TA and our tutorial group was very tight by the end of it! For those who say it's hard to get an A... just personally engage with the material rather than trying to read and memorize

I will have to disagree with most of the comments here. This class is not an easy class. Given the course load, this should at least be 6 credits. Countless hours of DVD readings, annoying emails, and long readings. Journals also takes longer than what was stated on the syllabus. Not a GPA booster, EASY B, but hard A. If a B boosts your GPA,goahead

This class is easy going, the lectures are boring sometimes, but you get to watch a gang member, and murders speack to you, tutorial are so fun, Melissa is awesome, NO EXAMS, just journal writing and watching $115 worth boring DVD set...Take the class it is easy marks and stressless

I'm sorry but I don't know what all the hype is about.  The class is boring as sin, she can't teach very well at all, and she didn't even start teaching about "Restorative Justice" until week 8.  The only good thing is the tutorials... make sure you get Melissa!  Best TA at SFU!

i loved this course! brenda is really interesting to listen too.  Both brenda and the TA's were really friendly.  Easy marks for an interesting class.  I reccommend this class to anyone, it really opens your eyes to RJ

Boring course but easy class. Journals and participation and in class final. No midterm/final and interesting guest speakers. DONT underestimate the journals cause this course can be a GPA booster if you put in the thought/effort. If you slack, don't be surprised with a lower mark. Guarenteed least a B even if you are ignorant. A+ if ur a tad smart

Brenda is a great prof. She really knows her stuff and is very interested in RJ. I had Melissa as a TA and she is great! She is really nice and very helpful. Brenda brought in really good guest speakers. Over all a very good prof, I would take another class with her again.
Really easy as long as you attend her class. The TA is not bad either

conflict in schools, aka RJ in schools.. amazingly interesting class taught by.  a prof that loves and writes on the subject. journals are like 315, so pretty simple. presentation were very interesting... overall i really enjoyed this class, and brenda knows a lot of this subject. Like usual brenda is pretty laid back, and her marking is the same.

AMAZING COURSE - and the prof is super-helpful.  She had a family emergency which is why she wasn't present (re:previous post).  She's not used to big lecture halls, but don't hold that against her - she REALLY knows her stuff!!!

It might be nice if she actually showed up when we had a guest speaker...you know, show some interest in the course perhaps.  Tutorials are AWESOME, TAs AMAZING. No final, which is nice and the journals are an easy mark if you incorporate the readings and tutorial content.  Lectures are a snooze fest except for guest speakers who have been great!
